name: dispiritingly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that causes you to not have much hope about a particular situation or problem: The whole situation seemed dispiritingly familiar. What could make him do such a thing? The answer, dispiritingly, is money.
More examplesFewer examplesThe movie's special effects are impressive, but the atmosphere remains dispiritingly flat.All his shots went dispiritingly wide of the goal. Their success proved dispiritingly short-lived.Dispiritingly, only 30% of businesses so far have achieved the target.
